result.execSummary:
The defendant Lashaun Dejuane Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying Concealed Weapon. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders a forfeiture in the amount of $150.00 including costs to be paid in 90 DAYS or civil judgment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lashaun Dejuane Hudson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lashaun Dejuane Hudson in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Lashaun Dejuane Hudson.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.
Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered:     
Charge amended to Carry Concealed Weapon Citation pursuant to s. 63.015 Wis. Stats. to which Defendant plead no contest. 
Court finds defendant guilty of amended charge.  Court orders a forfeiture in the amount of $150.00 including costs to be paid in 90 DAYS or civil judgment.

Defendant Lashaun Dejuane Hudson in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Lashaun Dejuane Hudson.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Pretrial conference held. Defense has received discovery and an offer. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Lashaun Dejuane Hudson in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests additional time.
Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.

Defendant Lashaun Dejuane Hudson in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Lashaun Dejuane Hudson not in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
